review.body:
Thanks @potsrevennil. 
I tested it and it works as intended: When you add the benchmark label it benchmarks once. If you want to benchmark again, you need to remove the label and add it again.

pull_request.title: Make the bench workflow trigger more naturally
pull_request.body:
[//]: # (SPDX-License-Identifier: CC-BY-4.0)
<!-- Please give a brief explanation of the purpose of this pull request. -->
Follow the [slothy](https://github.com/slothy-optimizer/slothy/blob/main/.github/workflows/test_basic.yaml#L8) approach as @hanno-becker and @mkannwischer suggested.

<!-- Does this PR resolve any issue?  If so, please reference it using automatic-closing keywords like "Fixes #123." -->

<!-- Any PR adding a new feature is expected to contain a test; the test should be part of CI testing, preferably within the ".github/workflows" directory tree. Please add an explanation to the PR if/when (why) this cannot be done. -->

<!-- Once your pull request is ready for review and passing continuous integration tests, please convert from a draft PR to a normal PR, and request a review. -->

labels.name: benchmark
labels.description: this PR should be benchmarked in CI

review.body:
Yes, @potsrevennil. 

I verified that now the Makefile triggers a re-build when a different `CYCLES` flag is passed. 

Maybe also keep track of the CFLAGS that are potentially passed from the outside?

pull_request.title: Makefile keep track of variables
pull_request.body:
[//]: # (SPDX-License-Identifier: CC-BY-4.0)
<!-- Please give a brief explanation of the purpose of this pull request. -->
This PR resolves the issue mentioned in https://github.com/pq-code-package/mlkem-c-aarch64/issues/75

<!-- Does this PR resolve any issue?  If so, please reference it using automatic-closing keywords like "Fixes #123." -->

<!-- Any PR adding a new feature is expected to contain a test; the test should be part of CI testing, preferably within the ".github/workflows" directory tree. Please add an explanation to the PR if/when (why) this cannot be done. -->

<!-- Once your pull request is ready for review and passing continuous integration tests, please convert from a draft PR to a normal PR, and request a review. -->

labels.name: benchmark
labels.description: this PR should be benchmarked in CI

review.body:
Okay, understood. 
Let's merge this one first, and think about the `CFLAGS` separately. 
For now users using custom CFLAGS need to run `make clean` in between, but I guess that is fine for now.

pull_request.title: Add github benchmark action
pull_request.body:
This adds benchmark visualization using https://github.com/benchmark-action/github-action-benchmark. 

When ever a new commit is pushed to the `main` branch, it will upload the benchmarks to the https://github.com/pq-code-package/mlkem-c-aarch64/tree/gh-pages branch and they will be visualized at https://pq-code-package.github.io/mlkem-c-aarch64/dev/bench.

This won't run on PRs (and it can't because these workflow runs won't have the permission to push commits -- see my comment below), so we can only see if it works the way it is intended if we merge it. 

I have performed extensive tests here: https://github.com/mkannwischer/bench-test
And you can see how it should look like here: https://mkannwischer.github.io/bench-test/dev/bench/
